channel.title: Getting frame input
channel.description:
I'm making a cooking class and I want it to have the original frame that says "shrimp" and when you right click it, it says "cook 1, cook 5, cook x, cook all". I have the frame there and it displays correctly, however it does nothing when I click an option. Does anyone know how to get the input from the click? For example, if the user clicks "cook 5", then it would return the integer 5. I should have no problem making it cook 5, I just need to know how to get the input in the first place. Thanks.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/XbvMa.jpg[/img]

item.title: Getting frame input
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Hand Cruel Hand
item.description:
@Cruel_Hand wrote:

I’m making a cooking class and I want it to have the original frame that says “shrimp” and when you right click it, it says “cook 1, cook 5, cook x, cook all”. I have the frame there and it displays correctly, however it does nothing when I click an option. Does anyone know how to get the input from the click? For example, if the user clicks “cook 5”, then it would return the integer 5. I should have no problem making it cook 5, I just need to know how to get the input in the first place.
Thanks.
